question: I’m unable to access the provider portal, what should I do?
answer: Try a different browser such as Chrome or Firefox or use incognito mode. Clear browser cache and cookies, switch your internet network, and if you see a blank white screen after login, type the portal URL directly and log in again.

question: My login says incorrect password even though I used euhler.
answer: The username is usually your email address, and the password is case-sensitive and should be typed exactly as “euhler” in lowercase by default. If it still does not work, ask your admin or ICT to reset the account.

question: The system says my code has already been used.
answer: This happens when the page times out or a draft claim was started earlier. Do not request a new code. Go to Manage Claims, select the existing draft claim, and continue. If still blocked, send the enrollee ID, authorization code, and facility name to ICT.

question: The system says code used for a patient admitted twice.

question: Who do I report issues to?

question: How can I log into Claimify?
answer: Visit https://app.claimify.ng, enter your email and password, optionally tick Remember Me, and click Login. After logging in, you will be redirected to the dashboard showing enrolment metrics and charts.

question: How do I use Claimify offline?
answer: Visit https://app.claimify.ng and click the link under the login button to access offline enrolment, or visit https://app.claimify.ng/offline-home directly. Ensure you are logged in before accessing the offline page.

question: How can I search for an enrollee?
answer: Click the search icon at the top-left of the dashboard and search using enrollee ID, phone number, NIN, first name, or last name. When searching by name, start with unique characters and use the browser Find tool if needed.

question: How do I enroll a new enrollee?
answer: Enrolment can be accessed via Manage Enrollees → Add Enrollee (Informal), Add Enrollee (Formal), or Add Enrollee (Offline).

answer.question: How do I enroll informal enrollees?
answer.answer: Select the plan (BHCPF, State Equity, or Voluntary Contributor), select special needs if applicable, complete all required fields marked with a red asterisk, capture or upload the enrollee photo, and submit the form.

section.question: How do I enroll formal sector enrollees?
section.answer: Select the formal enrolment category such as State or LGA Civil Servant, complete the form, and submit. Vulnerable groups are not included in formal enrolment. Incorrect forms will display red error messages.

section.question: How do I view approved claims?
section.answer: Claims are managed under Claims Management, where you can filter by sector, authorization code, enrollee number, facility, date range, and status. Verified claims can be forwarded for approval, and pending claims can be vetted or verified.

section.question: How do I process referrals?
section.answer: Referrals are accessed via Claims Management → View Referrals, where you can generate authorization codes or reject referrals. Authorization codes from referrals can be used for secondary claims, and referral details can be printed.

section.question: How do I add a primary encounter?
section.answer: Primary encounters are added via EMR → Add Record, filling visit details, diagnosis, outcome, and drugs. Secondary care authorization codes are requested via Claims Manager → Authorization Code, and secondary encounters are filled after approval using the authorization code.

section.question: How do I view registered facilities?

section.question: How do I fill M&E forms?
section.answer: Providers access the M&E Manager, select the form, click New M&E, confirm the popup, fill the form, preview, and submit. QA forms may appear but are only filled by authorized QA staff.
